xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Support from the Thailand Research Fund (RGJ-PhD Program), CAPEC of Technical University of Denmark (DTU) and the Computational Process Engineering Research Group, the Special Task Force for Activating Research (STAR), Chulalongkorn University Centenary Academic Development Project is gratefully acknowledged.

organization.$: Department of Chemical and Biochemical Engineering

head.citation-title: Optimal design of biodiesel production process from waste cooking palm oil
head.abstracts: A new process for biodiesel production from waste cooking palm oil containing 10 wt % of free fatty acid was proposed. The design methodology used various catalysts, i.e., alkali and acid catalysts in homogenous and heterogeneous forms, and different process, i.e., enzyme process and supercritical process. Biodiesel production using enzyme catalyst had the highest productivity; however, this process is not a competitive in an economic point of view. Homogeneous acid catalyst-based biodiesel process, which requires a large excess methanol and a catalyst neutralization process, was the worst process. The heterogeneous acid catalyzed process showed the highest NPV. A new process design process for the heterogeneous acid catalyzed process can save 41.5% energy, compared with the base case process. Biodiesel production using enzyme as catalyst was more sensitive to biodiesel price than the other processes, whereas the supercritical methanol process was sensitive to the glycerol price. This is an abstract of a paper presented at the CHISA 2012 - 20th International Congress of Chemical and Process Engineering and PRES 2012 - 15th Conference PRES (Prague, Czech Republic 8/25-29/2012).

source.sourcetitle-abbrev: CHISA - Int. Congr. Chem. Process Eng. PRES - Conf. PRES
